name: CampTO Plus at Spadina Museum
description: Kids can enjoy arts and crafts like paper making, clay modeling and baking, inspired by the historic Spadina house and gardens. Explore a 100-year-old home, uncovering hidden secrets and learning about life in the 1920s. With outdoor games, garden visits and creative projects, this camp offers a fun, unique experience like no other

name: Stars, Scars, Etched in Blue Art Exhibition

address.streetAddress: 399 The West Mall - Etobicoke Civic Centre

description:
Discover Hyunsun Park's captivating collection of gouache paintings that evoke empathy and connection. Each painting is a window into personal and shared experiences—stories of survival, resilience, and the search for meaning.

Join the Artist on Saturday August 9, 2 to 4 p.m. Light refreshments provided.

name: Live at the Clark with City Hall
description:
Scarborough is a diverse and vibrant community and that's why we're back for a fourth year with this free outdoor music series at Scarborough's Clark Centre for the Arts in partnership with City Hall Live. You'll get to spend three Monday evenings hanging out with fellow community members, listening to some of Canada's best rising Canadian musicians, with many from Scarborough!

The Clark Centre for the Arts is a community-oriented venue that is dedicated to providing opportunities for all ages to enjoy arts and culture. It's going to be a night of great music and good times—we hope you can join us!
